image.altText: Two cars parked outside a building with sign 'Little Shining Stars Early Learning Centre', a parent walks out of glass doors

props.synopsis: Parents at an Adelaide early learning centre under investigation have shared mixed views, as data reveals a number of centres have failed to comply with national laws since June.

title.children: Parents of Klemzig early learning centre speak out amid investigation

image.altText: chad Cornes announce retirements

props.synopsis: The club has told the 45-year-old assistant coach he won't be returning for the 2026 AFL season.Â

title.children: Former Premiership player Chad Cornes let go by Port Adelaide

image.altText: Dad of patient looks through an octogon shape beaming at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian theatre group has devised a new show, The Lensical, that provides young long-term patients with a thrilling bedside spectacle.

title.children: This beautiful performance takes place at the end of a hospital bed

image.altText: a man and woman smile at the camera with their arm around each other whilst holding rowing ores and kayak paddles in other hand

props.synopsis: After four months of dust storms and chilblains, Anja Wever and Cy Wever-Jetis say giving up was never an option.

title.children: Mother-son duo first to travel entire 2,500km of Murray River

image.altText: South Australia Livestock Exchange 2025-06-03 09:06:00

props.synopsis: Australia's sheep flock continues to decrease due to drought, with ewe numbers expected to drop 9 per cent over the next year.

title.children: Record lamb prices continue as Australian sheep flock shrinks further

image.altText: A couple pose in front of a brick home featuring solar panels on its roof in daylight

props.synopsis: SA Power Networks has begun collecting an "export tariff" from energy retailers at the same time as many solar customers saw a reduction in their feed-in tariffs. But it remains to be seen how, or if, the new export charge will be passed on to consumers.

title.children: Falling feed-ins and new export tariff frustrate solar customers

image.altText: Willie Rioli walks off the ground

props.synopsis: Willie Rioli speaks candidly about a tumultuous couple of months he endured this season, admitting he spoke to his manager on multiple occasions about retiring from the AFL.Â

title.children: Rioli considered retiring as racism and off-field drama became 'a bit too much'

image.altText: A large build up on cloud like foam on a beach.

props.synopsis: South Australian commercial fishers can apply to have licence and other government fees waived if their catches have been impacted by the state's toxic algal bloom, which has now spread to the Port River.

title.children: Fishing sector to have fees waived amid algal bloom, which has now spread to Port River

image.altText: The ASX building exterior.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is likely to fall slightly in morning trade after yesterday's surprise decision by the Reserve Bank to keep interest rates on hold. Wall Street finished trading flat after Donald Trump gave mixed signals about whether he would allow extensions to his new August 1 tariff deadline. Follow live.

title.children: ASX to slip after RBA's surprise interest rate decision, Trump announces further tariffs

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks and holds his hands open while Pete Hegseth, seated next to him, watches.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump flags a possible 200 per cent tariff on pharmaceuticals â one of Australia's biggest exports to the US â and says copper could be hit with a 50 per cent levy.

title.children: Trump flags tariffs of 200pc on pharmaceuticals, 50pc on copper

image.altText: Donald Trump turns his head to look back at Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The US president says he has authorised the delivery of more weapons to Ukraine, while he is considering "very strongly" a bill to levy a 500 per cent tariff on countries that continue to buy Russian oil.

title.children: 'A lot of bulls***': Trump lashes Putin and U-turns on weapons for Ukraine

image.altText: A smiling woman hugs an older man lying in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A retired farmer, who has lived in the country his whole life, has been told to move to Adelaide to continue receiving life-saving dialysis, as there are no options available closer to home.

title.children: Patient faces choice of moving to city or giving up life-saving treatment

image.altText: A close-up of a woman with a serious expression

props.synopsis: More than 500 current and former supermarket workers across regional South Australia will receive $5.5 million in back pay, after securing what their union describes as "one of the biggest retail underpayment settlements" in the state's history.

title.children: More than 500 supermarket workers to share in $5.5m after court settlement

image.altText: RBA sign behind market graphics

props.synopsis: RBA deputy governor Andrew Hauser says Donald Trump's tariffs could have a major impact on Australia's future, but it could take years to see what their final effects will be.Â

title.children: RBA expects Trump's tariffs to have 'profound' effect on Australia's economy

image.altText: Tuaina Taii Tualima of the Brumbies scores a try

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions will unleash a formidable team against the ACT Brumbies in Canberra, with the first Test against the Wallabies just 10 days away. Follow live.

image.altText: the wind blows balck and yellow flags with yellow writing attached to fences of building sites with buildings behind

image.altText: concrete bridge suspended above river with section missing with people underneath in boats

props.synopsis: At least nine people were killed after a bridge over a river collapsed in India's western Gujarat state, which has received heavy rains in recent days.

title.children: At least nine dead after bridge collapse in Gujarat state in western India

image.altText: A secluded road lined with trees.

props.synopsis: Two quaint South Gippsland towns east of Melbourne would likely have never been on the national map if not for Erin Patterson and her alleged foraging.

title.children: The quiet towns where Erin Patterson may have found her murder weapon

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

image.altText: a photo peering into an empty courtroom

props.synopsis: A former Northern Territory judge is facing accusations of sexual harassment from a former associate, who claims he suggested they go to a concert together and "share a bed to save money".Â

title.children: Former judge proposed sharing a bed with associate, complaint claims

image.altText: A smiling, ginger-haired man in a dark shirt sitting indoors.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been fined for stealing livestock from his neighbour after police used DNA testing to prove who the animals belonged to.

title.children: Victorian man fined for stealing sheep from neighbours

props.synopsis: Bega Group says Australia's peanut industry faces increased competition from imports and declining production.

title.children: Kingaroy and Tolga peanut processing plants to close, Bega announces

image.altText: A young smiling woman lays with her head resting on her guitar

title.children: She influenced Bob Dylan. Now this 90yo folk singer has a new album

image.altText: A close up of a woman named Fiona Argyle smiling while wearing a white top.

props.synopsis: A second childcare operator which employed alleged abuser Joshua Dale Brown has announced it will install CCTV across all centres.Â

title.children: Second childcare operator where alleged abuser worked to install CCTV

image.altText: A person in a yellow vest looks at debris surrounding the wreckage of an orange plane that lies on dirt.

props.synopsis: Air crash investigators have recovered video footage from inside an aerobatic aircraft that crashed at the Avalon Airshow, revealing the pilot may have attempted the mid-air stunt too low before crashing in front of thousands of spectators.

title.children: Mid-air stunt attempted too low before airshow crash, ATSB report suggests

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Telco giant Telstra is proposing job cuts that could see hundreds of employees gone. The Australian share market has fallen after yesterday's surprise decision by the Reserve Bank to keep interest rates on hold.

title.children: Telstra confirms 550 jobs facing the axe

image.altText: Sketch of a man with short hair, a white shirt and a black tie.

props.synopsis: The defence for the man accused of murdering young Clunes woman Hannah McGuire tells a jury his actions were "foolish" and "shameful" but he did not have murderous intent.

title.children: Trial hears alleged murderer would plead guilty to ex-partner's manslaughter

image.altText: A white house with a gabled roof tilted at an angle mid-submerged in brown raging floodwaters alongside a brown deck fence

props.synopsis: Emergency crews in the US state of New Mexico have carried out at least 85 swift water rescues, including of people who were trapped in their homes and cars, according to local weather authorities.

title.children: Search for missing people after fresh US floods sweep away homes, cars

title.children: Elon Musk is facing an uphill battle to see his political party succeed

image.altText: A woman points a cloth tapestry

props.synopsis: Officials said on Tuesday that the treasured medieval tapestry will be on loan from France and arrive next year at the British Museum.

title.children: 'One of the most iconic pieces of art' to return to England after almost 1,000 years

image.altText: Selfie shot of woman lying on grass, wearing white tshirt. She has brown hair and a necklace.

title.children: Search intensifies for German backpacker missing for more than a week

props.synopsis:
Petty Officer Scott Ruskan is being called an 'American hero' after helping rescue 165 people trapped at Camp Mystic in Kerr County, Texas, amid torrential floods.
